info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 8:35PM EDT until August 13 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL INDIANA COUNTY... At 835 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northwest of Belsano, or 8 miles east of Indiana, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Clymer, Dixonville, Commodore, Brush Vly, and Yellow Creek State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
